revised_title: The Chemistry and Function of Wing Pigments in Pierid Butterflies
tldr: This study investigates the chemistry of wing pigments in Pierid butterflies, revealing that the pigments are excretory substances. The yellow pigment found in most Pierid genera is a derivative of uric acid, and the white pigment in the white Pieridos contains uric acid as well. The pigments are used for ornamentation and are excreted by the butterflies as a normal byproduct.
